publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3691 Mrs Nanette Milne: Dogs Trust Campaign 2005—That the Parliament welcomes the Dogs Trust 2005 campaign, “A dog is still for life, not just for Christmas”; notes that the Christmas campaign aims to raise awareness of the consequences of treating dogs as gifts or toys; further notes that each year hundreds of dogs and puppies are still presented as gifts, of which a significant number are subsequently abandoned, and recognises the hard work of dog rescue centres across Scotland in the rehabilitation and rehoming of abandoned dogs. Supported by: Mr Jamie Stone*, Murdo Fraser*, Brian Adam*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Bruce Crawford*, Mary Scanlon*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*, Rosie Kane*, Mike Pringle*, Shiona Baird*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Robin Harper*, Mr David Davidson*, Alex Fergusson*, Chris Ballance*, Eleanor Scott*
S2M-3691 Dogs Trust Campaign 2005 (lodged on 7 December 2005) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Ms Sandra White*, John Scott*, Christine Grahame*, Tommy Sheridan*, Phil Gallie*

S2M-3691 Mrs Nanette Milne: Dogs Trust Campaign 2005—That the Parliament welcomes the Dogs Trust 2005 campaign, “A dog is still for life, not just for Christmas”; notes that the Christmas campaign aims to raise awareness of the consequences of treating dogs as gifts or toys; further notes that each year hundreds of dogs and puppies are still presented as gifts, of which a significant number are subsequently abandoned, and recognises the hard work of dog rescue centres across Scotland in the rehabilitation and rehoming of abandoned dogs. Supported by: Mr Jamie Stone, Murdo Fraser, Brian Adam, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Bruce Crawford, Mary Scanlon, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Frances Curran, Carolyn Leckie, Rosie Kane, Mike Pringle, Shiona Baird, Mr Mark Ruskell, Robin Harper, Mr David Davidson, Alex Fergusson, Chris Ballance, Eleanor Scott, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Ms Sandra White, John Scott, Christine Grahame, Tommy Sheridan, Phil Gallie, Linda Fabiani*, Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-3691 Dogs Trust Campaign 2005 (lodged on 7 December 2005) Margaret Mitchell*
S2M-3691 Dogs Trust Campaign 2005 (lodged on 7 December 2005) Mr Ted Brocklebank*, John Swinburne*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-3691 Dogs Trust Campaign 2005 (lodged on 7 December 2005) Elaine Smith*
